Message: The user completes the submission of the form

To generate your API Access Token, please follow these steps:
1. Log in to the Newsbreak Admanager Platform.
2. Click on Tools - Resources - API Access Tokens.
3. Click 'Generate token' to create your own API access token.
Remember, this token is tied to your user ID and should not be shared with anyone else. For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [How do I fetch my API access token?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/27680147056397-API-Integration-Guide).
Is the API access token in RedTrack configured at the account level or the event level?

The API access token in Newsbreak is tied to your user ID and should be generated at the account level. You can generate your own API access token by logging into the Newsbreak Admanager Platform and navigating to Tools - Resources - API Access Tokens. For more details, you can refer to this guide: [How do I fetch my API access token?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide).
Is the API access token in RedTrack configured at the account level or the event level?

The API access token in Newsbreak is configured at the account level. It's tied to your user ID and should be generated through the Newsbreak Admanager Platform. You can find more information on how to generate and manage your API access token here: [How do I fetch my API access token?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide).
then how will how will the redtrack identify different events

RedTrack identifies different events through the event management setup within your NewsBreak ad account. When setting up a postback, you can specify the event name and select your tracking type as 'Postback'. You then choose 'RedTrack' as the third-party tracking service and select your conversion event. This allows RedTrack to differentiate between various events based on the configuration you set in NewsBreak. For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this guide: [How to set up a RedTrack Postback on NewsBreak](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25515090832013-How-to-set-up-a-RedTrack-Postback-on-NewsBreak).
how will we differentiate those events made for redtrack made in newsbreak

To differentiate events made for RedTrack in NewsBreak, you can use the event name and conversion event type during the setup process. When creating a postback in NewsBreak, you specify the event name and select 'RedTrack' as your third-party tracking service. This setup allows you to track specific conversion events by naming them appropriately and choosing the correct event type. You can find more detailed instructions on setting up RedTrack postbacks here: [How to set up a RedTrack Postback on NewsBreak](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25515090832013-How-to-set-up-a-RedTrack-Postback-on-NewsBreak).

Sure! Here's an example of how you can differentiate events for RedTrack in NewsBreak:
1. **Event Name**: Let's say you want to track a 'Purchase' event. You would name the event 'Purchase' when setting it up in NewsBreak.
2. **Conversion Event Type**: During the setup, select 'Postback' as your tracking type and choose 'RedTrack' as the third-party tracking service.
3. **Event Type Specification**: Specify the conversion event type, such as 'complete_payment', to clearly define what action is being tracked.
By naming your events and specifying conversion types, you can easily differentiate between different actions tracked by RedTrack in NewsBreak.
For more detailed instructions, check out this guide: [How to set up a RedTrack Postback on NewsBreak](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25515090832013-How-to-set-up-a-RedTrack-Postback-on-NewsBreak).
what if we have two events named debt es and auto es, both has submit form event type. how will we differentiate

To differentiate between two events like 'debt es' and 'auto es', both having the 'submit form' event type, you can use unique identifiers or parameters within the postback URL. Here's how you can do it:
1. **Unique Event Names**: Ensure that each event has a distinct name, such as 'debt_es_submit_form' and 'auto_es_submit_form'.
2. **Custom Parameters**: Add custom parameters to the postback URL that are specific to each event. For example, you could include a parameter like `event_category=debt` or `event_category=auto`.
3. **Tracking IDs**: Use different tracking IDs or reference IDs for each event in your RedTrack setup.
By using these methods, you can clearly distinguish between similar events based on their context and additional parameters.
For more detailed instructions on setting up postbacks, refer to this guide: [How to set up a RedTrack Postback on NewsBreak](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/25515090832013-How-to-set-up-a-RedTrack-Postback-on-NewsBreak).
